results.title: Paradise road (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Village Roadshow Pictures, Samson Productions, Greg Coote, Sue Milliken and Bruce Beresford
results.brief_description: Based on actual events, this is the story of a group of Australian, British and Dutch women who, after the fall of Singapore in 1942, were held captive by the Japanese on the island of Sumatra. Herded into a brutal prisoner of war camp, the women soon discovered only the fittest, the strongest and the bravest could possibly survive such inhumane conditions. Stripped of everything they had, their irrepressible courage led them to find one voice, a vocal orchestra, singing music written for piano or orchestra. A voice that ultimately expressed their indomitable, unbreakable spirit. Cast includes Glenn Close, Pauline Collins, Frances McDormand, Cate Blanchett, Wendy Hughes, Pamela Rabe and Julianna Margulies.

results.title: Paradise of adventurers
results.creator_credit: Gwyneth Hughes, Yorkshire Television and Granite Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “China Rising”.
A two part program that details the history of China in tumultuous stages of its history from the 1920s through to the 1940s, seen through the eyes of the people living in Shanghai. Part one opens with Shanghai in the 1920s, a centre of foreign trade and colonialist occupation by the English and Japanese, disjointed rule of the country at the hands of warlords and the beginning of a concerted Nationalist and unification movement under the direction of Chiang Kai-Shek. The program discusses Chiang Kai-Shek and his KMT troops as they battled and defeated the warlords across China to unify the country under a Nationalist flag and outlines the growing opposition to foreign ownership and occupation and a reign of terror against them that also included those who had been made wealthy from foreign trade and saw an influx of these people to the International settlement in the relative safety of Shang-hai. The explosive Nationalist atmosphere of the time is also depicted through coverage of the “White Terror” which resulted in the execution of thousands of suspected communists in the country as the definitive drive for national unification increased. Part two discusses Shanghai under Nationalist rule where the left movement still thrived but under careful auspices of representing Nationalist ideals and where the strength of Japan as a ruler over China’s economy became ever more pointed in the puppet government of the Last Emperor and the Japanese invasion of Shang-hai in 1932. The program then outlines the subsequent humiliation of a truce with Japan and the rise to power in Northern China of the powerful son of a warlord that aligned himself with Chiang Kai-Shek and heightened the Nationalist’s campaigning and instigated an attempt to oust Japan which eventually consumed the country in a 12 year war with Japan which failed for the Nationalists but became a foundation for a rising tide of Communism. This comphrehensive documentary uses rare archival footage, interviews with the chinese and ex-patriot people of the time and coverage of the impact of this stage in China’s history on contemporary China and Taiwan to tell the story of this complex period of 20th century Chinese history. Includes Teachers notes.

results.title: Paradise lost: The Firebird by Stravinsky from Allegro non Troppo
results.brief_description: Excerpt from Bruno Bozzetto’s “Allegro Non Troppo”. Adam and Eve refuse to be tempted and the snake which eats the forbidden fruit tumbles through a myriad futuristic psychedelia. Music from Stravinsky’s “Firebird”. Animation by Walter Cavazzuti. No commentary, music only. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Paradise lost: a film from the painting of Hieronymus Bosch, 1462-1516
results.creator_credit: Panda Film, Colonna Film, Salvo D'Angelo, Luciano Emmer and Enrico Gras
results.brief_description: The paintings of the famous Dutch artist, Hieronymus Bosch set to music and story narration. Conveys the atmosphere of the strange world of this extraordinary painter in great detail. Close-ups are used continuously to show the highly imaginative works of minute detail: Adam and Eve in the Garden of Eden; the Temptation and the Fall.
results.title_for_label: Paradise lost: a film from the painting of Hieronymus Bosch, 1462-1516

results.title: Paradise lost
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Channel 4 and Antelope Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Testament: The Bible and history”.
In the last century the Bible has lost its central role as the scientific and moral arbiter. This programme describes this fall from sacredness and some of the visionaries who alternately attacked or protected the Bible’s word. The impact of men such as Martin Luther, Petrach, Walter Tindale who was the originator of the King James Bible, and Charles Darwin and his theory of evolution are seen as integral players in the history of the Bible.

results.title: Paradise lost
results.brief_description: A plea without words, made by artist and animator Evelyn Lambart, for the right of all creatures to a clean, unpolluted environment. With style, colour, and movement sensitive to the subject, the film shows how birds, butterflies, and other woodland creatures succumb to air pollution spread by the inventions of humans.

results.title: Paradise Camp
results.creator_credit: Cinetel, Frank Heimans and Paul Rea
results.brief_description: Paradise Camp is the story of Theresienstadt, the concentration camp which became the so-called Model Jewish community’, a macabre showpiece for the Red Cross and the world. The Nazis turned Theresienstadt into a smiling mask to distract the world from Auschwitz and the death camps. They called it the Paradise Camp. Survivors now living in Australia tell of how they were forced to take part in the bizarreGreat beautification’ and witnessed the making of a propaganda film by which the Nazis hoped to fool the world about their Final Solution to the Jewish Problem. The survivors also describe the emergence of a remarkable culture in the camp, a victory of the human spirit. It is brought to life by photographs and by the startling picture-journalism of the famous artists of Theresienstadt, whose works have been located for the film in museums around the world.

results.title: Paradise bent: boys will be girls in Samoa
results.brief_description: This documentary tells the story of the Samoan fa’afafines: boys who are raised as girls and play an important domestic role in traditional Samoan culture. The film explores the traditional role of the fa’afafines, the anthropological records of this phenomenon and the impact of the westernization of Samoa, particularly the threat posed by the infiltration of the Western ‘drag’ scene. Through interviews with fa’afafines, Samoan elders, academics, anthropologists and other western inhabitants of Samoa, the film explores and contrasts differing cultural constructions of gender and sexual identity and society.

results.title: Paradise (K)
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Douglas MacDonald and Ishu Patel
results.brief_description: A technical and visual masterpiece created by Ishu Patel. His creation of a fantastic kingdom where a Divine Bird performs a magic dance for an adoring emperor has won international acclaim. Innovative mixed-media techniques and dramatic lighting create a fabulous crystal chamber which is both palace and prison. A palace for the jealous blackbird who covets such an artificial paradise, and a prison for the Divine Bird, who has never enjoyed the freedom of the forest. Photographed by Pierre Landry. Animated by Ishu Patel and George Ungar. Music by Gheorghe Zamfir. (Awards: Berlin; Annecy; Gijon; Spain; Melbourne; Antibes-Juan-les-Pins; Los Angeles; Adelaide; Hamilton; Oakland; New York; Oscar nomination, Hollywood.)

results.title: Parade 88 -Farnborough 1970
results.brief_description: A report on the planes and displays to be seen at the 1970 Air Show. The Hawker Harrier, the only high speed jet air-craft that can take off from a ninety degree angle is profiled as well as the inimitable Red Arrows.
